title: White Paper: The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tool in the DSA Era
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, along with Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, co-authored this white paper exploring how the Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research. The paper focuses on the implementation of Article 40.12, which mandates Very Large Online Platforms (VLOPs) to provide access to “publicly available data.”
description: This white paper, co-authored by Fabio Giglietto, explores the impact of the Digital Services Act (DSA) on data access for platform research, specifically focusing on Article 40.12.

title: Meet: Team of University of Urbino Carlo Bo
snippet: This article introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team involved in the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto. It describes their role in Work Package 4 (WP4), which focuses on discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time using a content-agnostic approach, specifically addressing coordinated sharing behavior.
description: The article introduces the University of Urbino Carlo Bo team involved in the vera.ai project, led by Fabio Giglietto, and describes their role in discovering potentially problematic content in near-real-time.

title: Mapping Italian News Research Program - Uniurb
snippet: MINE, as a partner of the PROMPT project, is proud to announce the publication of an important white paper titled The State of Social Media Research APIs & Tools in the Digital Services Act Era. Co-authored by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi from the University of Urbino Carlo Bo, the white paper explores how the Digital Services Act (DSA) is transforming data access for platform research.
description: This news item from the University of Urbino's MINE program announces the publication of a white paper co-authored by Fabio Giglietto and Massimo Terenzi, focusing on the impact of the Digital Services Act on social media research data access.

title: The persistence and resilience of misinformation in the face of fact checking - Vera.ai
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, Massimo Terenzi (University of Urbino Carlo Bo) and Richard Rogers (University of Amsterdam) facilitated a project by vera.ai, entitled “The Persistence and Resilience of Misinformation in the Face of Fact Checking”, at the Digital Media Initiative (DMI) Winter School at the University of Amsterdam. The study is based on a dataset of 38,099 Facebook stories shared between 2017 and 2022, identified as problematic by Meta's third-party fact-checkers.
description: This Vera.ai post discusses a project on misinformation resilience facilitated by Fabio Giglietto, Massimo Terenzi, and Richard Rogers at the Digital Media Initiative Winter School. The project analyzed a large dataset of Facebook stories flagged by fact-checkers, aligning with Fabio Giglietto's expertise in disinformation studies and social media research.

title: Fabio Giglietto - Professore Ordinario GSPS-06/A Sociologia dei processi culturali e comunicativi - UniUrb
snippet: Fabio Giglietto is a Full Professor in Sociology of cultural and communicative processes at the University of Urbino Carlo Bo. The page provides contact information, research activities, and teaching programs.
description: This webpage is Fabio Giglietto's profile page on the University of Urbino Carlo Bo website. It provides information about his contact details, research activities, and teaching programs, confirming his position as a professor there.

title: L’articolo 21 nella gabbia di Facebook - Terzogiornale
Facebook premia gli estremisti: la ricerca dell'Università di Urbino - Lumsanews
SOS! ORA L’ALGORITMO PUNTA SUI ‘COMPLOTTISTI’: “INTERVENIRE SUBITO!” - ByoBlu
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Reports on Fabio Giglietto's presentation of collaborative research with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni at the International Seminar on Disinformation, Social Media, and Climate in Porto Alegre. The research explores using fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) to examine political talk in hyperpartisan Facebook groups.
description: The article discusses Fabio Giglietto's presentation at a conference in Brazil, focusing on research using LLMs to examine political talk in hyperpartisan Facebook groups. He presented collaborative work with Dr. Giada Marino and Bruna Paroni.
